Experten haben kürzlich vorgeschlagen, dass der Grund für die Lagerung der Objekte in Innenräumen darin lag, dass man in Englandland versuchte, die Sammlungen gestohlener Besitztümer in Museen zu verstecken.

es.title: MUSEO PARA HUMANOS (MODELO A ESCALA)
es.description: Los humanos preferían que sus museos fueran de interior. Esto resultó en principio desconcertante para los monstruos (¡sobre todo con lo que nos ahorramos de pasar el plumero al mantener los objetos en el exterior!). Los expertos han sugerido recientemente que tener los objetos bajo techo podría formar parte de los esfuerzos de Inglaterralandia por ocultar y almacenar las colecciones de objetos robados de los museos.

it.title: MUSEO PER UMANI (MODELLO IN SCALA)
it.description: Gli umani preferivano costruire i musei in ambienti chiusi. Questo inizialmente sembrò sconcertare i mostri (vista in particolare la mole di polvere che non si accumulerebbe all'aperto!). Gli esperti hanno di recente proposto che tenere gli oggetti al chiuso faceva parte dei tentativi dell'Inghilterraterra di nascondere e conservare le collezioni museali di merce rubata.

ja.title: 人間博物館(縮尺模型)
ja.description: 人間は屋内型の博物館を好んでいました。当初、モンスターたちにはこの考えが理解できませんでした(だって、それぞれの品を外に置いておけば、埃取りをしなくて済みますからね！)。専門家の直近の見解によると、展示物を屋内に留めておくことは、盗んできた博物館のコレクションを保管し、隠しておくというイングランドランドの画策であったのだろうとのことです。

ko.title: 인간을 위한 박물관(축소판)
ko.description: 인간들은 박물관을 실내에 조성하는 걸 선호했으며, 이 개념은 처음에는 몬스터들을 당황케 했습니다(특히 그 먼지를 일일이 털어야 할 걸 생각하면 말이죠). 하지만 최근 전문가들은 영국나라가 전시품을 실내에 보관한 것은 지금까지 전 세계에서 훔쳐온 물건들을 감추기 위한 노력이었지 모른다는 의견을 내놓았습니다.

zh-Hans.title: 人类博物馆（成比例模型）
zh-Hans.description: 人类更喜欢他们的博物馆在室内。这一开始似乎让怪兽们感到困惑（特别是考虑到我们把物体放在外面可避免的灰尘数量！）专家们最近表示，在某种程度上讲，英格兰大陆将物品存放在室内是为了隐藏和存放博物馆的被盗物品系列。

zh-Hant.title: 人類博物館 (比例模型)
zh-Hant.description: 人類喜歡將博物館設在室內。一開始，怪獸對這種行為感到困惑 (尤其是將物品放在戶外可避免大量灰塵！)。近期有專家表示，將物品放在室內可能是因為，英格蘭大陸極力想要隱藏並保存博物館的被盜物品系列。

ru.title: ЧЕЛОВЕЧЕСКИЙ МУЗЕЙ (МОДЕЛЬ В МАСШТАБЕ)
ru.description: Люди предпочитали размещать свои музеи в помещениях. Вначале монстры этого не понимали (особенно учитывая количество пыли, от которого мы спасаемся, оставляя предметы снаружи!). Недавно эксперты предположили, что содержание предметов в помещениях было результатом усилий англоземцев по сокрытию и хранению среди музейных экспонатов украденного имущества.

pt-BR.title: MUSEU PARA HUMANOS (EM ESCALA)
pt-BR.description: Os humanos preferiam museus internos, o que pode surpreender os monstros — já que evitamos o acúmulo de poeira com nossas exposições externas. Especialistas sugerem que o uso de espaços internos para guardar os objetos pode fazer parte dos esforços da Terra da Inglaterra para esconder as coleções de propriedades roubadas de outras nações.

nl.title: MUSEUM VOOR MENSEN (SCHAALMODEL)
nl.description: Mensen hadden hun museums liever binnen. Dit leek in eerste instantie verbijsterend voor monsters (zeker gezien de hoeveelheid stof die we vermijden door voorwerpen buiten te bewaren!). Deskundigen hebben onlangs gesuggereerd dat het binnen bewaren van voorwerpen deel uitmaakte van de inspanningen van Engelandland om collecties gestolen goederen van musea te verbergen en op te slaan.

ar.title: ﻣﺘﺤﻒ ﻟﻠﺒﺸﺮ )ﻧﻤﻮذج ﻣﺼﻐﺮ(
ar.description: ﻛﺎن اﻟﺒﺸﺮ ﻳﻔﻀﻠﻮن أن ﺗﻜﻮن ﻣﺘﺎﺣﻔﻬﻢ داﺧﻞ ﺑﻨﺎﻳﺎت. وﻛﺎن ﻫﺬا اﻷﻣﺮ ﻣﺤﻴﺮا ﻟﻠﻮﺣﻮش ﻓﻲ ﺑﺎدئ اﻷﻣﺮ )ﺧﺼﻮﺻﺎ ﺑﺎﻟﻨﻈﺮ إﻟﯽ ﻛﻤﻴﺔ اﻟﺘﻨﻈﻴﻒ اﻟﺘﻲ ﻧﺘﺠﻨﺒﻬﺎ ﺑﺈﺑﻘﺎء اﻷﺷﻴﺎء ﻓﻲ اﻟﺨﺎرج!(. وﻟﻜﻦ اﻟﺨﺒﺮاء اﻗﺘﺮﺣﻮا ﻣﺆﺧﺮا أن إﺑﻘﺎء اﻷﺷﻴﺎء ﻓﻲ اﻟﺪاﺧﻞ ﻗﺪ ﻳﻜﻮن ﺟﺰءا ﻣﻦ ﺟﻬﻮد إﻧﺠﻠﺘﺮا ﻹﺧﻔﺎء اﻟﻤﻘﺘﻨﻴﺎت اﻟﻤﺴﺮوﻗﺔ اﻟﺨﺎﺻﺔ ﺑﺎﻟﻤﺘﺤﻒ وﺗﺨﺰﻳﻨﻬﺎ.

tk.title: İNSANLAR İÇİN MÜZE (ÖLÇEKLİ MAKET)
tk.description: İnsanlar müzelerinin kapalı alanlarda olmasını tercih ediyordu. Başlangıçta bu, canavarlara çok şaşırtıcı gelmişti. (Özellikle de nesneleri dışarıda tutarak toz alma süresinden ettiğimiz tasarrufu düşününce!) Geçtiğimiz günlerde uzmanlar, nesneleri iç mekanlarda tutmanın İngiltere'nin çalınan eşyalardan oluşan koleksiyonları saklama çabası olduğunu öne sürdü.

fr-CA.title: MUSÉE POUR HUMAINS (MODÈLE RÉDUIT)
fr-CA.description: Les humains préféraient leurs musées couverts. Les monstres se sont d'abord sentis déroutés (surtout compte tenu de la quantité de poussière évitée en conservant les objets à l'extérieur !). Puis les experts ont récemment soulevé l'idée que garder des objets à l'intérieur pouvait faire partie des efforts de l'Angleterre pour cacher et stocker les collections d'objets volés des musées.

en-AU.title: MUSEUM FOR HUMANS (SCALE MODEL)
en-AU.description: Humans preferred their museums to be indoors. This initially seemed baffling to monsters (especially given the amount of dusting we avoid by keeping objects outside!). Experts have recently suggested that keeping objects indoors may have been part of Englandland's efforts to hide and store museums' collections of stolen property.

landmarks.title: MUSEUM FOR HUMANS (SCALE MODEL)
landmarks.description: Humans preferred their museums to be indoors. This initially seemed baffling to monsters (especially given the amount of dusting we avoid by keeping objects outside!). Experts have recently suggested that keeping objects indoors may have been part of Englandland's efforts to hide and store museums' collections of stolen property.

landmarks.name: LM_IntroPlaque

en.title: PLAQUE
en.description: The most recent human museum trick that monster experts have discovered is plaques. Any information on a plaque felt "truth-ier" to humans, even if it was just a guess. Researchers are still trying to determine if the same is true for monsters.

en-GB.title: PLAQUE
en-GB.description: The most recent human museum trick that monster experts have discovered is plaques. Any information on a plaque felt "truth-ier" to humans, even if it was just a guess. Researchers are still trying to determine if the same is true for monsters.

fr.title: PLAQUE
fr.description: La plus récente découverte des experts monstres sur les musées humains est celle des plaques. Toute information sur plaque était plus « vraie » pour les humains, même si rien ne le prouvait. Les chercheurs essaient toujours de déterminer si le phénomène s'applique aussi aux monstres.

de.title: SCHILD
de.description: Der neueste menschliche Trick für Museen, den Monsterexperten entdeckt haben, sind Schilder. Alle Informationen, die auf Schildern stehen, fühlten sich für Menschen „echter“ an, selbst wenn es sich nur um Vermutungen handelte. Forscher versuchen immer noch, herauszufinden, ob dasselbe auch für Monster gilt.

es.title: PLACA
es.description: El truco de museo humano más reciente que han descubierto los expertos monstruos son las placas. Toda información en una placa resultaba "más verídica" para los humanos, incluso aunque solo fuera una suposición. Los investigadores aún intentan determinar si sucede lo mismo con los monstruos.

it.title: TARGHETTA
it.description: L'inganno umano più recente che gli esperti mostri hanno scoperto sono le targhette all'interno dei musei. Ogni informazione contenuta su una targhetta sembrava "più veritiera" per gli umani, anche se si trattava solo di ipotesi. I ricercatori stanno ancora provando a determinare se valga lo stesso per i mostri.

ja.title: 飾り版
ja.description: モンスター専門家が発見した最新の人間博物館の技は、額縁です。どんな情報でも、当てずっぽうであっても、人間にとってはこの額縁に入れてありさえすれば「本当っぽく」聞こえてしまうのです。研究者たちは、モンスターたちにも同様のことが言えるのかどうかを調べています。

ko.title: 명판
ko.description: 최근 몬스터 전문가들은 인간 박물관에 명판이 붙어있다는 걸 알게 되었습니다. 인간들은 명판에 기재된 정보가 설령 그냥 짐작일 뿐이라 해도 '좀 더 진실에 가깝다'고 여겼던 것 같습니다. 학자들은 현재 몬스터들도 그렇게 생각할지에 대해 연구하고 있습니다.

zh-Hans.title: 牌匾
zh-Hans.description: 怪兽专家发现的人类博物馆最近的魔法是牌匾。人类觉得牌匾上的任何信息都“更真实”，即使它只是一个猜测。研究人员仍在试图确定怪兽们是不是也这样。

zh-Hant.title: 銘牌
zh-Hant.description: 最近怪獸專家在人類博物館發現的巧妙之處是銘牌。人類覺得銘牌上的任何資訊「更真實」，即便有些只是出於猜測。研究員仍然在確定怪獸們是否也是這樣。

ru.title: ТАБЛИЧКА
ru.description: Табличка — одна из последних обнаруженных экспертами монстров хитростей в человеческих музеях. Любая информация на табличке ощущалась людьми «правдивее», даже если это было просто предположение. Исследователи все еще пытаются определить, так ли это для монстров.

pt-BR.title: PLACA
pt-BR.description: O truque museológico humano mais recente descoberto pelos especialistas monstros são as placas: informações em placas eram mais críveis para os humanos, mesmo que fossem apenas suposições. Pesquisadores ainda estão tentando descobrir se monstros sofrem o mesmo efeito.

nl.title: PLAQUETTE
nl.description: De meest recente menselijke museumtruc die monsterdeskundigen hebben ontdekt, is plaquettes. Informatie op een plaquette voelde "waar-iger" voor de mens, ook al was het maar een gok. Onderzoekers proberen nog steeds vast te stellen of hetzelfde geldt voor monsters.

ar.title: اﻟﻼﻓﺘﺔ
ar.description: اﻟﻼﻓﺘﺎت ﻫﻲ أﺣﺪث ﺣﻴﻞ اﻟﺒﺸﺮ اﻟﺨﺎﺻﺔ ﺑﺎﻟﻤﺘﺎﺣﻒ اﻟﺘﻲ اﻛﺘﺸﻔﻬﺎ ﺧﺒﺮاء اﻟﻮﺣﻮش. ﻛﺎﻧﺖ أي ﻣﻌﻠﻮﻣﺎت ﻣﻜﺘﻮﺑﺔ ﻋﻠﯽ ﻻﻓﺘﺔ ﺗﺒﺪو "أﻛﺜﺮ ﺻﺤﺔ" ﻟﻠﺒﺸﺮ، ﺣﺘﯽ وإن ﻛﺎﻧﺖ ﻣﺠﺮد ﺗﺨﻤﻴﻦ. وﻣﺎزال اﻟﺒﺎﺣﺜﻮن ﻳﺤﺎوﻟﻮن ﺗﺤﺪﻳﺪ ﻣﺎ إذا ﻛﺎن اﻟﻮﺿﻊ ﻧﻔﺴﻪ ﻳﻨﻄﺒﻖ ﻋﻠﯽ اﻟﻮﺣﻮش أم ﻻ.

tk.title: TABELA
tk.description: Canavar uzmanların keşfettiği en son insan müzesi çakallığı işte bu tabelalar. Bir tabelada yazan herhangi bir bilgi, tahminden ibaret bile olsalar insanlara "daha doğru" geliyordu. Araştırmacılar, aynı şeyin canavarlar için de geçerli olup olmadığını bulmaya çalışıyor.

fr-CA.title: PLAQUE
fr-CA.description: La plus récente découverte des experts monstres sur les musées humains est celle des plaques. Toute information sur une plaque semblait plus « vraie » pour les humains, même si rien ne le prouvait. Les chercheurs essaient toujours de déterminer si le phénomène s'applique aussi aux monstres.

en-AU.title: PLAQUE
en-AU.description: The most recent human museum trick that monster experts have discovered is plaques. Any information on a plaque felt "truth-ier" to humans, even if it was just a guess. Researchers are still trying to determine if the same is true for monsters.

landmarks.title: PLAQUE
landmarks.description: The most recent human museum trick that monster experts have discovered is plaques. Any information on a plaque felt "truth-ier" to humans, even if it was just a guess. Researchers are still trying to determine if the same is true for monsters.

landmarks.name: LM_IntroPlinth

en.title: PLINTH
en.description: Humans liked to put objects on boxes called plinths. At first, monster experts didn't know why, but then strangers kept thinking the plinth-less exhibits were lost property and handing them in at the help desk. It turns out plinths are VERY important.

en-GB.title: PLINTH
en-GB.description: Humans liked to put objects on boxes called plinths. At first, monster experts didn't know why, but then strangers kept thinking the plinth-less exhibits were lost property and handing them in at the help desk. It turns out plinths are VERY important.

fr.title: SOCLE
fr.description: Les humains aimaient placer des objets sur des boîtes appelées « socles ». Au début, les experts monstres ignoraient pourquoi, puis les étrangers ont continué de penser que les objets exposés sans socle étaient des biens perdus, et les remettaient à l'accueil. Il s'avère donc que les socles sont TRÈS importants.

de.title: SOCKEL
de.description: Menschen stellten Gegenstände gern auf Möbelstücke namens „Sockel“. Zunächst verstanden Monsterexperten nicht genau, warum, aber dann fingen Besucher damit an, sockellose Ausstellungsstücke als Fundstücke an der Rezeption abzugeben. Wie sich herausstellt, sind Sockel SEHR wichtig.

es.title: PEDESTAL
es.description: A los humanos les gustaba poner objetos en cajas que se llamaban "pedestales". Al principio, los expertos monstruos no sabían por qué, pero los visitantes se pensaban que los artículos expuestos sin pedestal eran objetos perdidos y los llevaban al puesto de información. Resulta que los pedestales son MUY importantes.

it.title: BASAMENTO
it.description: Gli umani amavano mettere gli oggetti su scatole dette basamenti. All'inizio, gli esperti mostri non ne conoscevano il motivo, ma poi i mostri estranei al museo continuarono a pensare che gli oggetti senza basamenti fossero smarriti e li portavano all'ufficio informazioni. Quindi, i basamenti sono MOLTO importanti.

ja.title: 台座
ja.description: 人間は、台座と呼ばれるこの箱に展示品を乗せるのが好きでした。当初モンスター専門家にはこの理由が分からなかったのですが、訪問客たちが台座に置いていない展示品を見るたびに落とし物だと思い、ヘルプデスクに届けることが多々あったことから、台座の重要性を理解することができました。

ko.title: 받침대
ko.description: 인간들은 받침대라는 상자 위에 물건을 놓는 걸 즐겼습니다. 전문 몬스터들은 처음에는 그 이유를 알지 못했지만, 방문객들이 받침대가 없는 물건을 분실물인 줄 알고 자꾸 접수처에 가져다주는 상황이 발생하며 깨달음을 얻었습니다. 네, 받침대는 사실 꽤 중요한 물건이었던 겁니다.

zh-Hans.title: 底座
zh-Hans.description: 人类喜欢把物体放在称之为底座的盒子上。起初，怪兽专家不知道为什么，但后来新来的怪兽总是认为没有底座的展品是遗失之物，然后把它们交给帮助台。事实证明，底座非常重要。

zh-Hant.title: 基座
zh-Hant.description: 人類喜歡將物品放在稱作基座的箱子上。起初，怪獸專家們不清楚原因，但這些外來者總是認為，沒有基座的展品是遺失物，所以將它們交給服務櫃台。事實證明，基座非常重要。

ru.title: ПОСТАМЕНТ
ru.description: Людям нравилось помещать предметы на ящики, которые назывались постаментами. Сперва эксперты монстров не знали причину этого, но потом прохожие стали считать экспонаты без постамента потерянной собственностью и передавать их в справочную службу. Оказалось, постаменты ОЧЕНЬ важны.

pt-BR.title: PEDESTAL
pt-BR.description: Os humanos gostavam de colocar objetos sobre pedestal. Antigamente, os especialistas monstros não sabiam o motivo, mas os visitantes sempre achavam que as peças expostas sem pedestal eram objetos perdidos e levavam-nas para o balcão de informações. Pelo jeito, o pedestal é MUITO importante.

nl.title: SOKKEL
nl.description: Mensen hielden ervan om voorwerpen op kisten genaamd sokkels te plaatsen. In het begin wisten monsterdeskundigen niet waarom, maar toen bleven vreemden denken dat de sokkelloze stukken verloren voorwerpen waren en leverden ze in bij de helpdesk. Het blijkt dat sokkels ZEER belangrijk zijn.

ar.title: اﻟﻌﻠﺒﺔ
ar.description: ﻛﺎن اﻟﺒﺸﺮ ﻳﺤﺒﻮن وﺿﻊ اﻷﺷﻴﺎء ﻓﻲ ﺻﻨﺎدﻳﻖ ﺗﺴﻤﯽ اﻟﻌﻠﺐ. ﻓﻲ اﻟﺒﺪاﻳﺔ ﻟﻢ ﻳﻜﻦ ﺧﺒﺮاء اﻟﻮﺣﻮش ﻳﻌﺮﻓﻮن اﻟﺴﺒﺐ، ﺛﻢ اﺳﺘﻤﺮ اﻟﻐﺮﺑﺎء ﻓﻲ اﻻﻋﺘﻘﺎد ﺑﺄن اﻟﻤﻌﺮوﺿﺎت ﻏﻴﺮ اﻟﻤﻮﺿﻮﻋﺔ ﻓﻲ ﻋﻠﺒﺔ ﻣﻔﻘﻮدة وأﺧﺬوا ﻳﺴﻠﻤﻮﻧﻬﺎ إﻟﯽ ﻣﻜﺘﺐ اﻟﻤﺴﺎﻋﺪة. واﺗﻀﺢ أن اﻟﻌﻠﺐ ﻋﻨﺼﺮ ﺑﺎﻟﻎ اﻷﻫﻤﻴﺔ.

tk.title: KAİDE
tk.description: İnsanlar, nesneleri kaide denen kutuların üzerine koymayı seviyordu. Canavar uzmanlar ilk başta nedenini bilmiyordu, meğerse yabancılar kaide üzerinde olmayan sergi eşyalarının kayıp eşya olduğunu sanarak danışmaya götürüyorlarmış. Demek ki kaideler ÇOK önemliymiş.

fr-CA.title: SOCLE
fr-CA.description: Les humains aimaient placer des objets sur des boîtes appelées « socles ». Au début, les experts monstres ignoraient pourquoi, mais les étrangers croyaient que les pièces exposées sans socle étaient des objets perdus, et les remettaient à l'accueil. Il s'avère donc que les socles sont TRÈS importants.

en-AU.title: PLINTH
en-AU.description: Humans liked to put objects on boxes called plinths. At first, monster experts didn't know why, but then strangers kept thinking the plinth-less exhibits were lost property and handing them in at the help desk. It turns out plinths are VERY important.

landmarks.title: PLINTH
landmarks.description: Humans liked to put objects on boxes called plinths. At first, monster experts didn't know why, but then strangers kept thinking the plinth-less exhibits were lost property and handing them in at the help desk. It turns out plinths are VERY important.

landmarks.name: LM_IntroStanchion

en.title: STANCHION AND ROPES
en.description: This is another human museum magic trick: if you put little metal poles around an exhibit visitors will still get too close and prod it, BUT! if you connect the poles using velvet ropes, an invisible wall pops up and the exhibits are safe!

en-GB.title: STANCHION AND ROPES
en-GB.description: This is another human museum magic trick: if you put little metal poles around an exhibit visitors will still get too close and prod it, BUT! if you connect the poles using velvet ropes, an invisible wall pops up and the exhibits are safe!

fr.title: POTEAUX ET CORDES
fr.description: Un autre tour de magie des musées humains : si vous placez de petits poteaux métalliques autour d'un objet, les visiteurs s'en approcheront toujours trop pour les faire tomber, MAIS si vous reliez les poteaux à l'aide de cordes en velours, un mur invisible apparaît, sécurisant les expositions !

de.title: STANGEN UND SEILE
de.description: Ein weiterer magischer Museumstrick der Menschen: Wenn man kleine Metallstangen um ein Ausstellungsstück herum aufstellt, kommen Besucher ihm dennoch zu nahe, um es anzufassen. Wenn man aber die Stangen mittels Seilen aus Samt verbindet, entsteht plötzlich eine unsichtbare Wand und die Ausstellungsstücke sind sicher!

es.title: POSTES Y CUERDAS
es.description: Este es otro truco mágico de los museos humanos: si pones pequeños postes de metal alrededor de un objeto expuesto, los visitantes seguirán acercándose demasiado y lo empujarán. ¡PERO! si conectas los postes mediante cuerdas de terciopelo, ¡aparece un muro invisible y los objetos expuestos están a salvo!

it.title: PALI E CORDE
it.description: Un altro inganno magico da museo operato dagli umani: se si posizionano dei piccoli pali di metallo attorno a un reperto, i visitatori si avvicineranno comunque, MA se si collegano i pali usando corde di velluto, è come se si creasse un muro invisibile che proteggerà gli oggetti esposti!

ja.title: ポールとロープ
ja.description: これはもう一つの、人間博物館の技です。背丈の短い鉄のポールを展示品の周りに置いても、訪問者たちは近付いて展示品を突いてしまいます。ですが！このポールをベルベットのロープで繋ぐと透明の壁が出来上がり、展示品を安全に保つことができるのです！

ko.title: 봉과 밧줄
ko.description: 인간 박물관에서 쓰는 또 다른 마술입니다. 방문객들 주변에 금속 봉을 세워놓아도 방문객들은 자꾸 전시품에 가까이 가려 하는데, 봉 사이에 벨벳 밧줄을 연결하면 투명 벽이 생기면서 전시물을 안전하게 지킬 수 있습니다!

zh-Hans.title: 立杆和绳索
zh-Hans.description: 这是人类博物馆的又一个魔法：如果你在展品周围放置小金属杆，游客仍然会靠得很近并戳它，但是！如果你用丝绒绳索把立杆连起来，就会形成一堵无形的墙，这样展品就安全了！

zh-Hant.title: 支柱和繩索
zh-Hant.description: 這是另一個人類博物館的魔術：如果你在展品周圍放置小型金屬支柱，參觀者還是會靠得太近並戳到展品；但是，如果你用絲絨繩索連接支柱，會形成一堵隱形的牆體保護展品！

ru.title: СТОЛБЫ И ВЕРЕВКИ
ru.description: Еще одна хитрость в человеческих музеях: если поставить вокруг экспоната металлические опоры, посетители продолжат подходить ближе и тыкать в него пальцами. НО! Если соединить опоры бархатной веревкой, появляется невидимая стена, и экспонат находится в полной безопасности.

pt-BR.title: ORGANIZADORES
pt-BR.description: Outro truque de mágica nos museus humanos: se você colocar quatro pilares ao redor de uma peça em exposição, os visitantes ainda chegarão perto para tocá-la. Porém, se os pilares forem conectados por uma corda de veludo, uma parede invisível se forma e as peças ficam seguras!

nl.title: STAANDER EN TOUWEN
nl.description: Dit is een andere menselijke museumtruc: als je kleine metalen palen rondom tentoongestelde stukken plaatst, komen bezoekers nog steeds te dichtbij en raken ze aan, MAAR! als je de palen met fluwelen touwen verbindt, komt er een onzichtbare muur tevoorschijn en zijn de tentoongestelde stukken veilig!

ar.title: اﻟﺪﻋﺎﻣﺎت واﻟﺤﺒﺎل
ar.description: ﺗﻌﺪ ﻫﺬه اﻷدوات إﺣﺪى ﺣﻴﻞ اﻟﺒﺸﺮ اﻟﺴﺤﺮﻳﺔ اﻷﺧﺮى اﻟﺨﺎﺻﺔ ﺑﺎﻟﻤﺘﺎﺣﻒ: إذا وﺿﻌﺖ أﻋﻤﺪة ﻣﻌﺪﻧﻴﺔ ﺣﻮل اﻟﻤﻌﺮوﺿﺎت، ﻓﺴﻴﻈﻞ اﻟﺰوار ﻳﻘﺘﺮﺑﻮن ﻣﻨﻬﺎ ﺑﺪرﺟﺔ ﻛﺒﻴﺮة وﻳﻠﻤﺴﻮﻧﻬﺎ، أﻣﺎ إذا وﺻﻠﺖ اﻷﻋﻤﺪة ﺑﺤﺒﺎل ﻣﺨﻤﻠﻴﺔ، ﻓﺴﻴﻈﻬﺮ ﺟﺪار ﻏﻴﺮ ﻣﺮﺋﻲ وﺗﺼﺒﺢ اﻟﻤﻌﺮوﺿﺎت ﻓﻲ أﻣﺎن!

tk.title: DİREK VE ŞERİTLER
tk.description: Bu da başka bir insan müzesi çakallığı: Bir sergi eserinin etrafına küçük metal direkler koyarsanız ziyaretçiler yine de esere çok fazla yaklaşıp dokunabilirler. AMA! Direkleri kadife şeritlerle bağlarsanız görünmez bir duvar çıkar ve eserler güvende olur!

fr-CA.title: POTEAUX ET CORDES
fr-CA.description: Un autre tour de magie des musées humains : si vous placez de petits poteaux métalliques autour d'une pièce de l'exposition, les visiteurs s'en approcheront toujours trop et leur toucheront, MAIS si vous connectez les poteaux à l'aide de cordes en velours, un mur invisible apparaît, sécurisant les objets exposés!

en-AU.title: STANCHION AND ROPES
en-AU.description: This is another human museum magic trick: if you put little metal poles around an exhibit visitors will still get too close and prod it, BUT! if you connect the poles using velvet ropes, an invisible wall pops up and the exhibits are safe!

landmarks.title: STANCHION AND ROPES
landmarks.description: This is another human museum magic trick: if you put little metal poles around an exhibit visitors will still get too close and prod it, BUT! if you connect the poles using velvet ropes, an invisible wall pops up and the exhibits are safe!

landmarks.name: LM_JammyBiscuit

en.title: JAMMY BISCUITS
en.description: Of all the preserved human snacks we have unearthed, monster experts are fondest of jammy biscuits. Apparently they "love the aesthetic of ruby red jam against golden shortbread" and stress that "experts have NOT been nibbling the exhibits".

en-GB.title: JAMMY BISCUITS
en-GB.description: Of all the preserved human snacks we have unearthed, monster experts are fondest of jammy biscuits. Apparently they "love the aesthetic of ruby red jam against golden shortbread" and stress that "experts have NOT been nibbling the exhibits".

fr.title: BISCUITS À LA CONFITURE
fr.description: De toutes les collations humaines conservées que nous avons déterrées, les biscuits à la confiture sont les préférées des experts monstres. Visiblement, ils « adorent l'esthétique de la confiture rouge rubis en opposition au doré du sablé » et soulignent que « les experts n'ont PAS goûté aux objets exposés ».

de.title: MARMELADENKEKSE
de.description: Von allen erhaltenen menschlichen Nahrungsmitteln, die wir ausgegraben haben, sind den Monsterexperten die Marmeladenkekse am liebsten. Anscheinend „lieben sie die Ästhetik der rubinroten Marmelade im Kontrast mit dem goldgelben Keks“ und betonen, dass „Experten NICHT an den Ausstellungsstücken geknabbert haben“.

es.title: GALLETAS JAMMY
es.description: De entre todos los aperitivos humanos conservados que hemos desenterrado, los expertos monstruos consideran las galletas jammy como las más preciadas. Al parecer, les encanta "la estética de mermelada roja rubí en contraposición a la galleta de mantequilla dorada" y subrayan que "los expertos NO han estado mordisqueando los objetos expuestos".

it.title: BISCOTTI ALLA MARMELLATA
it.description: Tra tutti gli snack umani in buone condizioni che abbiamo rinvenuto, i biscotti alla marmellata sono quelli per cui gli esperti mostri vanno matti. A quanto pare, questi ultimi "adorano l'estetica della marmellata rossa spalmata tra due frollini dorati" e insistono che "NON hanno mangiato i reperti".

ja.title: ジャム付きのビスケット
ja.description: 発掘して保護している人間のお菓子の中でも、モンスター専門家が最も気に入っているのがジャム付きのビスケットです。どうやら彼らは、「ルビーレッドのジャムが、黄金のショートブレッドに付いている美的思想が好きだ」と言っており、「専門家が展示品をつまみ食いしているなどという事実はありません」と強く主張しています。

ko.title: 잼 비스킷
ko.description: 지금까지 발굴한 온전한 인간 간식 중에서 몬스터 전문가들이 가장 좋아하는 것이 바로 잼 비스킷입니다. 이들은 "황금색의 작은 빵 사이에 루비처럼 빛나는 붉은 잼의 자태가 아름답다"고 평하면서도 "전문가들은 절대 전시물을 먹지 않는다"고 주장했습니다.

zh-Hans.title: 果酱饼干
zh-Hans.description: 在我们发现的所有人类果脯蜜饯零食中，怪兽专家最喜欢的是果酱饼干。显然，他们“喜欢红宝石果酱的美感，而不喜欢黄金脆饼”，并强调“专家们并没有啃展品”。

zh-Hant.title: 果醬餅乾
zh-Hant.description: 在所有我們發現人類長期保存的點心中，怪獸專家們最喜歡吃果醬餅乾。牠們顯然「喜歡寶紅色果醬的美感，而討厭金色酥餅」，並強調「專家沒有啃食過展品」。

ru.title: ПЕЧЕНЬЕ С ВАРЕНЬЕМ
ru.description: Из всех обнаруженных нами сохранившихся человеческих закусок эксперты монстров особенно неравнодушны к печенью с вареньем. По всей видимости, они «любят эстетику ярко-красного варенья на румяных песочных коржиках» и подчеркивают, что «эксперты НЕ грызли экспонаты».

pt-BR.title: BISCOITOS RECHEADOS
pt-BR.description: De todos os lanches humanos descobertos até hoje, especialistas monstros consideram biscoitos recheados o melhor. Eles aprovam a “estética da geleia avermelhada entre as bolachas” e enfatizam que “nenhum especialista provou o material expositivo”.

nl.title: JAMKOEKJES
nl.description: Van alle mensenversnaperingen die we hebben ontdekt, houden monsterexperts het meest van jamkoekjes. Blijkbaar houden ze van de mooie combinatie van de rode jam en het gouden koekje. De experts beweren dat ze niet aan de tentoongestelde koekjes hebben geknabbeld.

ar.title: ﺑﺴﻜﻮﻳﺖ اﻟﻤﺮﺑﯽ
ar.description: ﻣﻦ ﺑﻴﻦ ﺟﻤﻴﻊ اﻟﻮﺟﺒﺎت اﻟﺨﻔﻴﻔﺔ اﻟﺒﺸﺮﻳﺔ اﻟﻤﺤﻔﻮﻇﺔ اﻟﺘﻲ ﻋﺜﺮ ﻋﻠﻴﻬﺎ، ﻳﻌﺸﻖ ﺧﺒﺮاء اﻟﻮﺣﻮش ﻣﺬاق ﺑﺴﻜﻮﻳﺖ اﻟﻤﺮﺑﯽ. ﻳﺒﺪو أﻧﻬﻢ "ﻳﺤﺒﻮن اﻟﺠﻤﺎل اﻟﻔﻨﻲ ﻟﻠﻤﺮﺑﯽ داﻛﻨﺔ اﻟﺤﻤﺮة ﻋﻠﯽ اﻟﻤﺨﺒﻮزات اﻟﻬﺸﺔ ذﻫﺒﻴﺔ اﻟﻠﻮن"، ﺑﺎﻟﻄﺒﻊ ﻷﻧﻨﺎ ﻧﺆﻛﺪ أن "اﻟﺨﺒﺮاء ﻟﻢ ﻳﺘﺬوﻗﻮا ﻫﺬه اﻟﻤﻌﺮوﺿﺎت".

tk.title: REÇELLİ BİSKÜVİ
tk.description: Ortaya çıkardığımız tüm korunmuş insan atıştırmalıkları arasında canavar uzmanların en sevdiği atıştırmalık reçelli bisküvi oldu. Herhalde "altın rengi kurabiye arasındaki yakut rengi reçelin görüntüsünü" sevmişler. "Uzmanların sergi eserlerini ASLA ucundan ısırmadıklarını" belirttiler.

fr-CA.title: BISCUITS À LA CONFITURE
fr-CA.description: De toutes les collations humaines conservées que nous avons déterrées, les biscuits à la confiture sont les préférées des experts monstres. Évidemment, ils « adorent l'esthétique de la confiture rouge rubis en opposition au doré du sablé » et soutiennent que « les experts n'ont PAS goûté aux objets exposés ».

en-AU.title: JAMMY BISCUITS
en-AU.description: Of all the preserved human snacks we have unearthed, monster experts are fondest of jammy biscuits. Apparently they "love the aesthetic of ruby red jam against golden shortbread" and stress that "experts have NOT been nibbling the exhibits".

landmarks.title: JAMMY BISCUITS
landmarks.description: Of all the preserved human snacks we have unearthed, monster experts are fondest of jammy biscuits. Apparently they "love the aesthetic of ruby red jam against golden shortbread" and stress that "experts have NOT been nibbling the exhibits".

landmarks.name: LM_JuicePouch

en.title: RELUCTANT DRINK SAC
en.description: This drink does not want to be drunk. It even seems to have developed an immunity to its own specially provided straw. Monster scientists are currently torn between respecting the drink's wishes and fetching the big scissors from Head Office.

en-GB.title: RELUCTANT DRINK SAC
en-GB.description: This drink does not want to be drunk. It even seems to have developed an immunity to its own specially provided straw. Monster scientists are currently torn between respecting the drink's wishes and fetching the big scissors from Head Office.

fr.title: SAC DE BOISSON RÉTICENT
fr.description: Cette boisson ne veut pas être bue. Elle semble même avoir développé une immunité contre sa propre paille intégrée. Les scientifiques monstres sont actuellement partagés entre respecter les souhaits de la boisson ou aller chercher la grosse paire de ciseaux au siège social.

de.title: Widerspenstiger Trinkbeutel
de.description: Dieses Getränk will nicht getrunken werden. Es hat scheinbar sogar eine Immunität gegen den extra mitgelieferten Strohhalm entwickelt. Monsterforscher sind hin- und hergerissen dazwischen, die Wünsche des Getränks zu respektieren oder eine riesige Schere aus dem Hauptbüro zu holen.

es.title: BRIK DE BEBIDA RETICENTE
es.description: Esta bebida no quiere que la consuman. Incluso da la sensación de que ha desarrollado inmunidad a la pajita que la acompaña. Los monstruos científicos ahora mismo se dividen entre respetar los deseos de la bebida o traer las tijeras grandes de la oficina central.

it.title: SACCA DI BEVANDA RILUTTANTE
it.description: Questa bevanda non vuole essere bevuta. Sembra che abbia persino sviluppato un'immunità alla sua cannuccia. Gli scienziati mostri sono combattuti tra il rispettare i desideri della bevanda o prendere le forbici grosse dall'ufficio dell'amministrazione.

ja.title: 渋々のドリンク袋
ja.description: この飲み物は、飲まれたりするのは嫌だと感じています。しかもこの飲み物は、自分に特別に与えられているストローに対して耐性を発達させたようなのです。モンスター科学者たちは現在、この飲み物の願いを尊重すべきなのか、メインオフィスから大きなハサミを取って来るべきなのかの二択に悩まされています。

ko.title: 망설이는 음료수 가방
ko.description: 이 음료수는 먹히고 싶지 않아 합니다. 심지어 같이 있는 전용 빨대에조차 면역이 된 것 같습니다. 몬스터 과학자들은 현재 음료수의 의도를 존중해줘야 할지, 아니면 그냥 사무실에서 큰 가위를 가져와야 할지 고민하고 있습니다.

zh-Hans.title: 不情不愿的饮料包
zh-Hans.description: 这份饮料不希望被喝掉。甚至于，它都发育出了针对自己特别提供吸管的抵抗措施。怪兽科学家们目前发生了分化：是尊重饮品的意愿还是从总部拿来大剪刀。

zh-Hant.title: 不情願飲料包
zh-Hant.description: 這包飲料不想被喝掉。它甚至對它特製的吸管都產生了免疫力。怪獸科學家們現在左右為難，到底是要尊重這飲料的意願呢，還是到總部去拿把大剪刀來。

ru.title: УПАКОВКА УПРЯМОГО НАПИТКА
ru.description: Этот напиток не хочет, чтоб его выпили. По всей видимости, он даже выработал иммунитет к соломинке, которая идет с ним в комплекте. Монстры-ученые нынче стоят перед дилеммой: уважить желания напитка или же принести большие ножницы из центрального офиса?

pt-BR.title: SACO DE BEBIDA RESISTENTE
pt-BR.description: Esta bebida não quer ser consumida. Parece até que ela desenvolveu uma imunidade ao seu próprio canudinho fornecido. Os cientistas monstros estão divididos no momento entre respeitar o desejo da bebida e pegar a tesoura grande no escritório central.

nl.title: TERUGHOUDENDE DRINKZAK
nl.description: Dit drankje wil niet gedronken worden. Het lijkt zelfs immuniteit te hebben ontwikkeld voor zijn eigen speciaal verstrekte rietje. Monsterwetenschappers vragen zich af of ze de wensen van het drankje moeten eerbiedigen of de grote schaar van het hoofdkantoor moeten halen.

ar.title: ﻋﺒﻮة ﺷﺮاب ﻣﻜﺮوه
ar.description: ﻫﺬا اﻟﻤﺸﺮوب ﻻ ﻳﻤﻜﻦ ﺗﺠﺮﻋﻪ. ﺣﺘﯽ أﻧﻪ ﻳﺒﺪو أﻧﻪ ﻃﻮر ﺣﺼﺎﻧﺔ ﺿﺪ اﻟﻤﺎﺻﺔ اﻟﺨﺎﺻﺔ ﺑﻪ. ﺑﻴﻨﻤﺎ ﺗﻔﺮق ﻋﻠﻤﺎء retsnoM ﺣﺎﻟﻴﺎ ﺑﻴﻦ ﺿﺮورة اﺣﺘﺮام رﻏﺒﺎت اﻟﺸﺮاب وإﺣﻀﺎر اﻟﻤﻘﺺ اﻟﻜﺒﻴﺮ ﻣﻦ اﻟﻤﻜﺘﺐ اﻟﺮﺋﻴﺴﻲ.

tk.title: İSTEKSİZ İÇECEK SAC
tk.description: Bu içecek birileri onu içsin istemiyor. Hatta kendi pipetine karşı bir bağışıklık geliştirmiş gibi görünüyor. Canavar bilim insanları kararsız: İçeceğin isteklerine saygı duymalılar mı yoksa Merkez Ofis'ten büyük makası getirmeliler mi?

fr-CA.title: SAC DE BOISSON RÉTICENT
fr-CA.description: Cette boisson ne veut pas être bue. Elle semble même avoir développé une immunité contre sa propre paille intégrée. Les scientifiques monstres sont actuellement partagés entre le respect des souhaits de la boisson ou la grosse paire de ciseaux au siège social.

en-AU.title: RELUCTANT DRINK SAC
en-AU.description: This drink does not want to be drunk. It even seems to have developed an immunity to its own specially provided straw. Monster scientists are currently torn between respecting the drink's wishes and fetching the big scissors from Head Office.

landmarks.title: RELUCTANT DRINK SAC
landmarks.description: This drink does not want to be drunk. It even seems to have developed an immunity to its own specially provided straw. Monster scientists are currently torn between respecting the drink's wishes and fetching the big scissors from Head Office.

landmarks.name: LM_JunkMail

en.title: JUNK MAIL
en.description: As laws around rubbish disposal became stricter, enterprising humans came up with increasingly devious ways to offload their litter. One method was to affix a stamp and an address label to an unwanted item, then post it to one's enemies.

en-GB.title: JUNK MAIL
en-GB.description: As laws around rubbish disposal became stricter, enterprising humans came up with increasingly devious ways to offload their litter. One method was to affix a stamp and an address label to an unwanted item, then post it to one's enemies.

fr.title: COURRIER INDÉSIRABLE
fr.description: Alors que les lois sur l'élimination des déchets se durcissaient, les humains les plus ingénieux ont trouvé des moyens de plus en plus détournés de se débarrasser de leurs déchets. Une méthode consistait à apposer un tampon et une étiquette d'adresse sur un objet indésirable pour l'envoyer par la poste à un ennemi.

de.title: MÜLLPOST (JUNK MAIL)
de.description: Als die Gesetze zur Abfallentsorgung strenger wurden, kamen geschäftstüchtige Menschen auf immer hinterhältigere Wege, ihren Müll loszuwerden. Eine Methode war es, an einem unerwünschten Gegenstand eine Briefmarke und einen Adressaufkleber zu befestigen und ihn an seine Feinde zu schicken.

es.title: CORREO BASURA
es.description: A medida que las leyes sobre recogida de basuras se hacían más estrictas, a los empresarios humanos se les fueron ocurriendo maneras cada vez más retorcidas de deshacerse de sus residuos. Uno de los métodos consistía en pegar un sello y una etiqueta con una dirección a un objeto no deseado y luego enviárselo a los enemigos.

it.title: POSTA SPAZZATURA
it.description: Viste le nuove leggi più severe sullo smaltimento dei rifiuti, gli umani intraprendenti inventarono modi sempre più subdoli per liberarsi della spazzatura. Un metodo consisteva nel mettere un francobollo e un indirizzo sull'oggetto indesiderato per poi spedirlo ai propri nemici.

ja.title: ジャンクメール
ja.description: ゴミ捨てに関する法律が厳しくなるにつれ、野心的な人間たちは自分たちのゴミを家からなくすためのもっとずる賢い方法を思いつきました。その内の一つが、いらないモノに切手と住所ラベルを貼り、自分の宿敵に送るという方法だったのです。

ko.title: 쓰레기 우편
ko.description: 쓰레기 처리법이 엄격해지면서 사업을 하는 인간들은 쓰레기를 줄이기 위한 교묘한 술책을 생각해냈습니다. 그 중 하나가 원하지 않는 물건에 우편 도장을 찍고 주소를 적어 적에게 보내는 것이었습니다.

zh-Hans.title: 垃圾邮件
zh-Hans.description: 随着有关垃圾处理的法律越来越严格，有胆量的人类想出各种邪门歪道来丢弃他们的垃圾。有一种方法是在不需要的物品上贴上邮票和地址标签，然后寄给敌人。

zh-Hant.title: 垃圾郵件
zh-Hant.description: 由於垃圾處理相關法規越來越嚴格，有創新精神的人類想出不正當的方法來丟棄垃圾。其中一個方法是將不想要的物品貼上郵票和地址標籤，然後寄給敵人。

ru.title: МУСОРНАЯ ПОЧТА
ru.description: По мере того, как законы об утилизации мусора становились строже и строже, находчивые люди изобретали всё более хитрые способы избавиться от отходов. Одним из способов было приклеить к нежелательному предмету марку и этикетку с адресом и отправить его по почте своим врагам.

pt-BR.title: CORRESPONDÊNCIA DESCARTÁVEL
pt-BR.description: Com o desenvolvimento de leis mais rígidas acerca do descarte de lixo, os humanos mais engenhosos passaram a criar maneiras cada vez mais criativas de se desfazer do lixo. Um dos métodos consistia em colocar um selo e um destinatário — que normalmente era um inimigo.

nl.title: AFVALPOST
nl.description: Naarmate wetten betreffende afvalverwijdering strenger werden, kwamen ondernemende mensen met steeds slimmere manieren om hun afval af te voeren. Een van de methodes was het aanbrengen van een postzegel en een adreslabel op een ongewenst voorwerp en het vervolgens naar vijanden te sturen.

ar.title: اﻟﺒﺮﻳﺪ ﻏﻴﺮ اﻟﻤﻬﻢ
ar.description: ﺑﻴﻨﻤﺎ أﺻﺒﺤﺖ ﻗﻮاﻋﺪ اﻟﺘﺨﻠﺺ ﻣﻦ اﻟﻘﻤﺎﻣﺔ أﻛﺜﺮ ﺻﺮاﻣﺔ، اﺑﺘﻜﺮ اﻟﺒﺸﺮ اﻟﺬﻳﻦ ﻻ ﻳﺨﺸﻮن اﻟﺘﻐﻴﻴﺮ ﻃﺮﻗﺎ ﻣﻠﺘﻔﺔ ﺑﺸﻜﻞ ﻣﺘﺰاﻳﺪ ﻟﺘﻔﺮﻳﻎ ﻧﻔﺎﻳﺎﺗﻬﻢ. ﻛﺎﻧﺖ إﺣﺪى ﻫﺬه اﻟﻄﺮق ﻫﻲ وﺿﻊ ﻣﻠﺼﻖ ﺑﻄﺎﺑﻊ وﻋﻨﻮان ﻋﻠﯽ ﻋﻨﺼﺮ ﻏﻴﺮ ﻣﺮﻏﻮب ﻓﻴﻪ، ﺛﻢ ﻳﺮﺳﻠﻪ اﻟﺸﺨﺺ إﻟﯽ أﻋﺪاﺋﻪ.

tk.title: ÇÖP POSTA
tk.description: Çöplerin imha edilmesiyle ilgili yasalar katılaştıkça, girişimci insanlar çöplerini boşaltmak için giderek daha dolambaçlı yollar buldular. Bir yöntem de istenmeyen bir nesneye bir damga ve adres yapıştırıp düşmanlara göndermekti.

fr-CA.title: COURRIER INDÉSIRABLE
fr-CA.description: Alors que les lois sur l'élimination des déchets se durcissaient, les humains les plus ingénieux ont trouvé des moyens de plus en plus tordus de se débarrasser de leurs déchets. Une méthode consistait à apposer un timbre et une étiquette d'adresse sur un objet indésirable pour l'envoyer à ses ennemis par la poste.

en-AU.title: JUNK MAIL
en-AU.description: As laws around rubbish disposal became stricter, enterprising humans came up with increasingly devious ways to offload their litter. One method was to affix a stamp and an address label to an unwanted item, then post it to one's enemies.

landmarks.title: JUNK MAIL
landmarks.description: As laws around rubbish disposal became stricter, enterprising humans came up with increasingly devious ways to offload their litter. One method was to affix a stamp and an address label to an unwanted item, then post it to one's enemies.

landmarks.name: LM_Keyboard

en.title: ALPHABET COLLECTION
en.description: During the Era Of Maximum Computering, humans developed a curiously personal relationship with the written language. One manifestation of this was how humans would set a framed alphabet on their desk and then stroke it almost non-stop for eight full hours.

en-GB.title: ALPHABET COLLECTION
en-GB.description: During the Era Of Maximum Computering, humans developed a curiously personal relationship with the written language. One manifestation of this was how humans would set a framed alphabet on their desk and then stroke it almost non-stop for eight full hours.

fr.title: COLLECTION D'ALPHABETS
fr.description: À l'ère de l'apogée informatique, les humains ont développé une relation curieusement étroite avec la langue écrite. Une manifestation du phénomène était la façon qu'ils avaient de poser un alphabet encadré sur leur bureau pour le caresser presque sans interruption pendant huit heures d'affilée.

de.title: ALPHABETSAMMLUNG
de.description: Während der Ära der maximalen Computerisierung entwickelten Menschen eine ungewöhnlich persönliche Beziehung zu ihrer geschriebenen Sprache. Eine Ausprägung davon war die Tatsache, dass Menschen ein gerahmtes Alphabet auf ihre Schreibtische stellten, worauf sie dann fast acht Stunden lang durchgehend tippten.

es.title: COLECCIÓN ALFABÉTICA
es.description: Durante la Era de la Computación Máxima, los humanos desarrollaron una curiosa relación personal con el lenguaje escrito. Una manifestación de ello era cómo los humanos ponían un alfabeto enmarcado en sus escritorios y luego lo golpeaban casi sin parar durante ocho horas seguidas.

it.title: COLLEZIONE ALFABETO
it.description: Durante l'Era del Computer Massimo, gli umani svilupparono una relazione personale curiosa con i linguaggi scritti. A manifestazione di ciò vi è un alfabeto incorniciato sulle loro scrivanie che loro picchiettavano senza sosta per otto ore piene.

ja.title: アルファベットコレクション
ja.description: 最大コンピューター時代、人間たちは活字との間に非常に興味深い個人的な関係を築き上げました。この兆候の1つは、人間が枠に収まったアルファベットセットを机の上に置き、それをほぼノンストップで8時間打っているということでした。

ko.title: 글자 컬렉션
ko.description: 최대 컴퓨터 사용 시대에 인간들은 적힌 글자와 독특한 개인적 친분을 쌓기 시작했습니다. 그 중 하나가 네모 칸마다 글자를 하나씩 써넣고 책상에 올려놓은 뒤 8시간 내내 쉬지 않고 치는 행위였습니다.

zh-Hans.title: 字母集
zh-Hans.description: 在最大限度使用计算机的时代，人类与书面语言形成一种奇特的人际关系。其中一种表现是，人类在桌上摆上一套框好的字母表，然后在整整 8 个小时里几乎不间断地敲打它。

zh-Hant.title: 字母收藏品
zh-Hant.description: 在大運算時代，人類與書寫語言發展出一段奇特的人際關係。其中一種表現方式就是，人類會在桌上放置一組加框字母，然後在整整八小時內，幾乎不間斷地敲打字母。

ru.title: КОЛЛЕКЦИЯ БУКВ АЛФАВИТА
ru.description: В эпоху максимальной компьютеризации у людей сложились странные отношения с письменным языком. Одним из их проявлений было то, что люди заключали буквы алфавита в рамку у себя на столе и стучали по ним почти безостановочно целых восемь часов.

pt-BR.title: COLEÇÃO COMPLETA DO ABECEDÁRIO
pt-BR.description: Durante a denominada Era da Máxima Computação, os humanos desenvolveram uma relação pessoal curiosa com a língua escrita. Uma das manifestações deste fenômeno era o costume de montar um alfabeto emoldurado em suas escrivaninhas e acariciá-lo por oito horas, sem interrupção.

nl.title: ALFABETVERZAMELING
nl.description: Tijdens de Gouden Computereeuw kreeg de geschreven taal een steeds belangrijkere plaats in het leven van mensen. Een van de manieren waarop mensen hun liefde voor letteren lieten zien, was met een ingelijst alfabet op hun bureau, die ze acht uur per dag aantikten.

ar.title: ﻣﺠﻤﻮﻋﺔ اﻟﺤﺮوف اﻷﺑﺠﺪﻳﺔ
ar.description: ﻓﻲ أﺛﻨﺎء ﻋﺼﺮ ذروة اﻟﻜﻤﺒﻴﻮﺗﺮ، أﻗﺎم اﻟﺒﺸﺮ ﻋﻼﻗﺔ ﺷﺨﺼﻴﺔ ﻏﺮﻳﺒﺔ ﻣﻊ اﻟﻠﻐﺔ اﻟﻤﻜﺘﻮﺑﺔ. وأﺣﺪ ﺗﺠﻠﻴﺎت ﻫﺬه اﻟﻌﻼﻗﺔ ﻫﻲ ﺟﻠﻮس اﻟﺒﺸﺮ ﻣﻊ اﻟﺤﺮوف اﻷﺑﺠﺪﻳﺔ اﻟﻤﺠﻤﻌﺔ داﺧﻞ إﻃﺎر ﻣﻮﺿﻮع ﻋﻠﯽ اﻟﻤﻜﺘﺐ واﻟﻨﻘﺮ ﻓﻮﻗﻬﺎ ﺑﻼ ﺗﻮﻗﻒ ﺗﻘﺮﻳﺒﺎ ﻟﻤﺪة ﺛﻤﺎﻧﻲ ﺳﺎﻋﺎت ﻛﺎﻣﻠﺔ.

tk.title: ALFABE KOLEKSİYONU
tk.description: Maksimum Bilgi İşlem Çağı'nda insanların yazılı dille kurduğu kişisel ilişki merak uyandırır nitelikteydi. İnsanların masalarına koyup sekiz saat boyunca neredeyse hiç ara vermeden basıp durdukları çerçeveli alfabeler de bunun en belirgin kanıtlarından biridir.

fr-CA.title: ALPHABET DE BUREAU
fr-CA.description: À l'ère de l'apogée informatique, les humains ont développé une relation curieusement étroite avec la langue écrite. Ceci s'observait entre autres par la façon qu'ils avaient de poser un alphabet encadré sur leur bureau pour le caresser presque sans interruption pendant huit heures d'affilée.

en-AU.title: ALPHABET COLLECTION
en-AU.description: During the Era Of Maximum Computering, humans developed a curiously personal relationship with the written language. One manifestation of this was how humans would set a framed alphabet on their desk and then stroke it almost non-stop for eight full hours.

landmarks.title: ALPHABET COLLECTION
landmarks.description: During the Era Of Maximum Computering, humans developed a curiously personal relationship with the written language. One manifestation of this was how humans would set a framed alphabet on their desk and then stroke it almost non-stop for eight full hours.

landmarks.name: LM_Knight

en.title: HORSE SCULPTURE (SCALE MODEL)
en.description: These tiny horse sculptures were often included in sets of more abstract objects, each packaged with a black and white board. Although the horse heads could be quite ornate, none of the sculptors seemed able to work out how to do horse legs, so the carvings all stop at the neck.

en-GB.title: HORSE SCULPTURE (SCALE MODEL)
en-GB.description: These tiny horse sculptures were often included in sets of more abstract objects, each packaged with a black and white board. Although the horse heads could be quite ornate, none of the sculptors seemed able to work out how to do horse legs, so the carvings all stop at the neck.

fr.title: STATUE ÉQUESTRE (MODÈLE RÉDUIT)
fr.description: Ces petites sculptures de chevaux faisaient souvent partie d'ensembles d'objets plus abstraits, chacun emballé avec un tableau noir et blanc. Certaines têtes étaient très travaillées, mais aucun sculpteur ne semblait savoir comment réaliser des jambes de cheval, ainsi les sculptures s'arrêtent toutes au cou.

de.title: PFERDESKULPTUR (MASSSTABSGETREUES MODELL)
de.description: Diese kleinen Pferdeskulpturen waren meist in Sätzen abstrakterer Objekte enthalten und jeweils zusammen mit einem schwarzweiß gemusterten Brett verpackt. Die Pferdeköpfe waren zwar oft sehr kunstvoll gearbeitet, aber keiner der Bildhauer schien in der Lage zu sein, die Beine von Pferden herzustellen, also enden alle Schnitzereien am Hals.

es.title: ESCULTURA DE CABALLO (MODELO A ESCALA)
es.description: Estas diminutas esculturas de caballo se incluían a menudo en sets de objetos más abstractos, que constaban también de un tablero blanco y negro. Aunque la cabeza del caballo podía estar bastante ornamentada, ninguno de los escultores pareció ser capaz de resolver cómo hacer patas de caballo, de manera que todas las tallas se detienen en la parte del cuello.

it.title: SCULTURA DI CAVALLO (MODELLO IN SCALA)
it.description: Queste piccole sculture di cavalli erano spesso incluse in set di oggetti più astratti insieme a una tavola bianca e nera. Nonostante si avesse l'impressione che le teste dei cavalli fossero ben elaborate, nessuno degli scultori sembrava capace di fare le zampe dei cavalli, quindi si fermavano al collo.

ja.title: 馬の彫像(縮尺模型)
ja.description: この小さな馬の彫像は、ほとんどの場合、より抽象的オブジェクトのセットに含まれており、それぞれが黒と白のボードに同梱されていました。この馬の頭部は非常に華美な作りなのに対して、彫刻家は誰も馬の脚を彫る方法を知らなかったため、彫刻は首から下がありません。

ko.title: 말 조각상(축소판)
ko.description: 이 작은 말 조각상은 보통 검은색과 흰색이 있는 판과 다른 추상적인 조각들과 함께 있습니다. 말의 머리는 꽤 장식적이지만, 조각가들은 말 다리를 만드는 법을 몰랐던 것인지 모두 목까지만 제작되었습니다.

zh-Hans.title: 雕像马（成比例模型）
zh-Hans.description: 这些非常小的雕像马通常包含在更抽象的成套物品中，每套都有一个黑白板。尽管马头可能相当华丽，但似乎没有一个雕像家能想出如何打造马腿，所以雕像作品都到脖子就没了。

zh-Hant.title: 馬雕像 (比例模型)
zh-Hant.description: 這些小型的馬雕像經常出現在更抽象的物品集中，每一組附有黑白相間的木板。雖然馬頭極為華麗，卻沒有一位雕刻家能夠刻出馬腳，因此所有雕像都只刻到脖子而已。

ru.title: СКУЛЬПТУРА КОНЯ (МОДЕЛЬ В МАСШТАБЕ)
ru.description: Эти крошечные скульптуры коня зачастую были частью наборов с более абстрактными предметами, укомплектованными черно-белой доской. И хотя головы коней могли быть довольно изысканно украшены, никто из скульпторов не смог понять, как сделать лошадиные ноги, поэтому резные фигурки оканчиваются шеей.

pt-BR.title: ESCULTURA DE CAVALO (EM ESCALA)
pt-BR.description: Estas pequenas esculturas de cavalos faziam parte de um conjunto, entre outras esculturas mais abstratas, sempre embaladas com uma placa quadriculada em preto e branco. Apesar da cabeça do cavalo ser muito bem detalhada, nenhum escultor sabia esculpir pernas para os animais, portanto todas as estátuas paravam no pescoço.

nl.title: PAARDENSCULPTUUR (SCHAALMODEL)
nl.description: Deze kleine paardensculpturen werden vaak opgenomen in sets van abstractere objecten, elk verpakt in een zwart-witte plank. Hoewel de paardenkoppen vrij sierlijk konden zijn, leek geen van de beeldhouwers in staat om paardenbenen uit te werken, zodat de sculpturen allemaal stoppen bij de hals.

ar.title: ﺗﻤﺜﺎل اﻟﺤﺼﺎن )ﻧﻤﻮذج ﻣﺼﻐﺮ(
ar.description: ﻛﺎﻧﺖ ﺗﻤﺎﺛﻴﻞ اﻷﺣﺼﻨﺔ اﻟﺼﻐﻴﺮة ﻫﺬه ﻋﺎدة ﺟﺰءا ﻣﻦ ﻣﺠﻤﻮﻋﺎت ﻣﻜﻮﻧﺔ ﻣﻦ ﻋﻨﺎﺻﺮ أﻛﺜﺮ ﺗﺠﺮﻳﺪا، ﺗﺠﻤﻊ ﻛﻞ ﻣﺠﻤﻮﻋﺔ ﻓﻴﻬﺎ ﻣﻊ ﻟﻮﺣﺔ ﺑﺎﻟﻠﻮﻧﻴﻦ اﻷﺑﻴﺾ واﻷﺳﻮد. وﻋﻠﯽ اﻟﺮﻏﻢ ﻣﻦ أن رؤوس اﻷﺣﺼﻨﺔ ﻳﻤﻜﻦ أن ﺗﻜﻮن ﻣﺰﺧﺮﻓﺔ ﺑﻌﺾ اﻟﺸﻲء، ﻟﻢ ﻳﻔﻠﺢ أي ﻧﺤﺎت ﻓﻲ ﻣﻌﺮﻓﺔ ﻛﻴﻔﻴﺔ ﻧﺤﺖ أﻗﺪام اﻟﺤﺼﺎن، ﻟﺬا ﺗﻮﻗﻔﺖ ﻋﻤﻠﻴﺔ اﻟﻨﺤﺖ ﺑﺄﻛﻤﻠﻬﺎ ﻋﻨﺪ اﻟﻌﻨﻖ.

tk.title: AT HEYKELİ (ÖLÇEKLİ MAKET)
tk.description: Bu minik at heykelleri genellikle daha soyut nesnelerden oluşan setlerin içinde yer alıyordu. Bu setlerin her biri siyah ve beyaz bir tahtayla paketlenirdi. Atların kafası epey süslü olmasına rağmen heykeltıraşlar herhalde at bacağı yapmasını bilmediklerinden oymalar hep boyunda bitiyor.

fr-CA.title: SCULPTURE HIPPIQUE (MODÈLE RÉDUIT)
fr-CA.description: Ces petites sculptures de chevaux faisaient souvent partie d'ensembles d'objets plus abstraits, tous emballés avec un tableau noir et blanc. Certaines têtes de cheval étaient très décorées, mais aucun sculpteur ne semblait savoir comment réaliser des jambes de cheval, ainsi les sculptures s'arrêtent toutes au cou.

en-AU.title: HORSE SCULPTURE (SCALE MODEL)
en-AU.description: These tiny horse sculptures were often included in sets of more abstract objects, each packaged with a black and white board. Although the horse heads could be quite ornate, none of the sculptors seemed able to work out how to do horse legs, so the carvings all stop at the neck.

landmarks.title: HORSE SCULPTURE (SCALE MODEL)
landmarks.description: These tiny horse sculptures were often included in sets of more abstract objects, each packaged with a black and white board. Although the horse heads could be quite ornate, none of the sculptors seemed able to work out how to do horse legs, so the carvings all stop at the neck.

landmarks.name: LM_Kraken

en.title: KRAKEN
en.description: Considered lost by humans, the Kraken takes the form of a gigantic tentacled sea monster capable of destroying whole ships. It should be noted that the Kraken is not considered lost by other sea creatures, and has been described by several narwhals as "embarrassingly clingy".

en-GB.title: KRAKEN
en-GB.description: Considered lost by humans, the Kraken takes the form of a gigantic tentacled sea monster capable of destroying whole ships. It should be noted that the Kraken is not considered lost by other sea creatures, and has been described by several narwhals as "embarrassingly clingy".

fr.title: KRAKEN
fr.description: Considéré comme une légende par les humains, le Kraken prend la forme d'un gigantesque monstre marin tentaculaire capable de détruire des navires entiers. Il convient de noter que le Kraken n'est pas considéré comme une légende par les autres créatures marines et a même été décrit par plusieurs narvals comme étant « un peu trop collant ».

de.title: KRAKE
de.description: Die von Menschen verschollen geglaubte Krake war ein gigantisches Seeungeheuer mit Tentakeln, das in der Lage war, ganze Schiffe zu zerstören. Es ist hervorzuheben, dass die Krake bei anderen Meereslebewesen nicht als verschollen galt und von mehreren Narwalen als „unangenehm anhänglich“ beschrieben wurde.

es.title: KRAKEN
es.description: El kraken, que los humanos consideran una criatura desaparecida, adopta la forma de un gigantesco monstruo marino con tentáculos capaz de destruir barcos. Debería tenerse en cuenta que otras criaturas marinas no consideran al kraken una criatura desaparecida y varios narvales lo describen como "una lapa".

it.title: KRAKEN
it.description: Considerato estinto dagli umani, il Kraken ha la forma di un gigantesco mostro marino tentacolare capace di distruggere intere navi. Va però detto che il Kraken non è considerato estinto da altre creature marine ed è stato descritto da molti narvali come "incredibilmente appiccicoso".

ja.title: クラーケン
ja.description: 人間たちが絶滅したと考えているクラーケンとは、船全体を破壊することができる、巨大な触手を持つ海の怪物の形をしています。これは注記ですが、他の海の生き物たちは、クラーケンが絶滅したとは思っておらず、複数のイッカクのが、「恥ずかしいほどベタベタ付いてくる」と証言しています。

ko.title: 크라켄
ko.description: 인간들은 크라켄이 거대한 촉수 바다 괴물로, 배 한 척도 통째로 파괴할 수 있으며 지금은 사라졌다고 믿었습니다. 하지만 다른 바다 생물들은 크라켄이 사라지지 않았으며, 일각 고래들은 크라켄이 엄청 앵긴다고 불평했습니다.

zh-Hans.title: 北海巨妖
zh-Hans.description: 北海巨妖是一种有触须的巨型海怪，能够摧毁整艘船，人类以为它已经消失。应该注意的是，其他海洋生物并没有觉得它消失了，而且很多独角鲸觉得它们“甩都甩不掉”。

zh-Hant.title: 克拉肯
zh-Hant.description: 人類以為消失的克拉肯，是一種長著巨大觸手，能夠摧毀整艘船隻的海怪。需要注意的是，其他海洋生物並不認為克拉肯消失了，有些獨角鯨甚至形容牠們會「死纏爛打」。

ru.title: КРАКЕН
ru.description: Кракен, выглядящий как огромное морское чудовище со щупальцами, способное уничтожить целый корабль, считался людьми исчезнувшим. Надо отметить, другие морские существа не считали кракена исчезнувшим, несколько нарвалов описали его как «излишне прилипчивого».

pt-BR.title: KRAKEN
pt-BR.description: Considerado pelos humanos como uma criatura perdida, o kraken é um monstro marinho enorme, cheio de tentáculos, capaz de destruir navios inteiros. É importante observar que o kraken não é considerado uma criatura perdida por outras criaturas marinhas, visto que vários narvais já declararam que o acham “pegajoso demais”.

nl.title: KRAKEN
nl.description: De kraken, die als verloren werd beschouwd door de mensen, heeft de vorm van een gigantisch tentakelzeemonster dat hele schepen kan vernietigen. Opgemerkt moet worden dat de kraken niet als verloren wordt beschouwd door andere zeedieren en door verschillende narwallen als "beschamend klef" wordt beschreven.

ar.title: وﺣﺶ اﻟﻜﺮاﻛﻦ
ar.description: ﻳﺘﺨﺬ اﻟﻜﺮاﻛﻦ اﻟﺬي ﻳﻌﺪه اﻟﺒﺸﺮ ﺣﻴﻮاﻧﺎ ﻣﻔﻘﻮدا ﺷﻜﻞ وﺣﺶ ﺑﺤﺮي ﺑﻤﺠﺴﺎت ﻗﺎدرة ﻋﻠﯽ ﺗﺪﻣﻴﺮ ﺳﻔﻦ ﺑﺄﺳﺮﻫﺎ. واﻟﺠﺪﻳﺮ ﺑﺎﻟﺬﻛﺮ أن اﻟﻜﺮاﻛﻦ ﻻ ﻳﻌﺪ ﺣﻴﻮاﻧﺎ ﻣﻔﻘﻮدا ﺑﺎﻟﻨﺴﺒﺔ إﻟﯽ اﻟﻜﺎﺋﻨﺎت اﻟﺒﺤﺮﻳﺔ اﻷﺧﺮى، وﻗﺪ وﺻﻔﻪ ﻋﺪد ﻣﻦ ﺣﻴﺘﺎن ﺣﺮﻳﺶ اﻟﺒﺤﺮ ﺑﺄﻧﻪ " ﻟﺰج ﺑﺸﻜﻞ ﻣﺤﺮج".

tk.title: KRAKEN
tk.description: İnsanlar tarafından kaybolduğu düşünülen Kraken, tüm gemileri yok edebilecek devasa bir dokunaçlı deniz canavarı biçimini alıyor. Diğer deniz yaratıklarının Kraken'in kaybolduğunu düşünmediğine dikkat çekilmelidir. Ayrıca bazı deniz gergedanları da bu yaratığı "utanç verici derecede ilgi meraklısı" olarak tanımlıyor.

fr-CA.title: KRAKEN
fr-CA.description: Considéré éteint par les humains, le Kraken prend la forme d'un gigantesque monstre marin tentaculaire capable de détruire des navires entiers. Il faut toutefois noter que le Kraken n'est pas considéré éteint par les autres créatures marines et a même été décrit par plusieurs narvals comme étant « un peu trop collant ».

en-AU.title: KRAKEN
en-AU.description: Considered lost by humans, the Kraken takes the form of a gigantic tentacled sea monster capable of destroying whole ships. It should be noted that the Kraken is not considered lost by other sea creatures, and has been described by several narwhals as "embarrassingly clingy".

landmarks.title: KRAKEN
landmarks.description: Considered lost by humans, the Kraken takes the form of a gigantic tentacled sea monster capable of destroying whole ships. It should be noted that the Kraken is not considered lost by other sea creatures, and has been described by several narwhals as "embarrassingly clingy".

landmarks.name: LM_Lasagna

en.title: LASAGNE (FERAL)
en.description: This leftover slice of lasagne was abandoned in a workplace refrigerator when its owner decided to pop out for lunch instead. Microbes on the forgotten lasagne eventually formed a colonial organism that stole a yogurt, smashed through a window, and menaced a postal worker. It was last seen scampering off into the wilds of Kettering.

en-GB.title: LASAGNE (FERAL)
en-GB.description: This leftover slice of lasagne was abandoned in a workplace refrigerator when its owner decided to pop out for lunch instead. Microbes on the forgotten lasagne eventually formed a colonial organism that stole a yoghurt, smashed through a window, and menaced a postal worker. It was last seen scampering off into the wilds of Kettering.

fr.title: LASAGNES (SAUVAGES)
fr.description: Cette part de lasagnes restante a été abandonnée dans un réfrigérateur de bureau lorsque son propriétaire a préféré déjeuner dehors. Des microbes ont fini par former un organisme colonial qui a volé un yaourt, s'est défenestré et a menacé un facteur. Elle a été vue pour la dernière fois dans les plaines de Kettering.

de.title: LASAGNE (WILD)
de.description: Dieses übrig gebliebene Stück Lasagne wurde in einem Bürokühlschrank zurückgelassen, als sein Besitzer beschloss, stattdessen zu Mittag essen zu gehen. Mikroben auf der vergessenen Lasagne haben sich schließlich zu einem Schwarmorganismus entwickelt. der einen Joghurt gestohlen, ein Fenster zerbrochen und einen Postboten bedroht hat. Er wurde zuletzt gesehen, wie er in die Wildnis von Kettering hoppelte.

es.title: LASAÑA (SALVAJE)
es.description: Este trozo sobrante de lasaña fue abandonado en el frigorífico de una oficina cuando su propietario decidió salir a comer fuera. Los microbios sobre la lasaña olvidada terminaron formando un organismo colonial que robó un yogur, hizo añicos una ventana y amenazó a un cartero. Fue visto por última vez corriendo a toda prisa hacia el páramo de Kettering.

it.title: LASAGNE (BESTIALI)
it.description: Questo pezzo avanzato di lasagne venne abbandonato nel frigorifero di un ufficio quando il suo proprietario decise di andare a mangiare fuori. I microbi sulle lasagne abbandonate diedero poi origine a un organismo che rubò uno yogurt, scappò dalla finestra e minacciò un postino. L'ultima volta è stato avvistato mentre si dileguava tra le terre selvagge di Kettering.

ja.title: ラザニア(野生化)
ja.description: この残り物のラザニアは、元々はお昼に食べようと持ってきたのに、職場の冷蔵庫に入れたままにして持ち主がランチに出かけてしまったものです。最終的にはこの忘れられたラザニアの微生物が支配的な生命体を作り上げてヨーグルトを盗み、窓を突き破って、郵便局員を脅かしました。ケタリングの森へ走り去るところが最後の目撃情報です。

ko.title: 라자냐(치명적)
ko.description: 이 남은 라자냐는 주인이 밖에서 점심을 먹기로 결정하면서 회사 냉장고에 그대로 버려졌습니다. 잊혀진 라자냐에 살던 미생물들은 결국 군체 생물로 진화해서 요거트를 훔친 뒤 그걸 창문 밖으로 던져 우체부를 공격했습니다. 이후 군체가 케터링의 야생으로 떠나가는 모습이 목격되었습니다.

zh-Hans.title: 凶猛千层面
zh-Hans.description: 这份剩余的千层面是在它的主人决定出去吃午饭后被扔在办公室冰箱的。后来，这份被遗忘的千层面上的微生物，最终形成了一种群体生物，它不仅偷走酸奶、打破窗户逃离，还威胁了一名邮差。有人最后一次看到它，是它仓皇跑进凯特灵的荒野中。

zh-Hant.title: 凶猛千層麵
zh-Hant.description: 這份千層麵是它的主人決定外出吃午餐而遺留在辦公室冰箱的廚餘。後來，在這份被遺忘的千層麵上的微生物，變成了群體生物，不僅偷走了優格、打破窗戶逃離，還威脅一名郵差。它最後一次被看到時，是它倉皇跑進凱特靈的荒野中。

ru.title: ЛАЗАНЬЯ (ОДИЧАВШАЯ)
ru.description: Этот кусок лазаньи остался лежать на работе в холодильнике, когда его владелец решил выйти на обед. В конце концов микробы организовали на этой забытой лазанье колониальный организм, украли йогурт, разбили окно и угрожали почтальону. В последний раз кусок лазаньи видели, когда он удирал в дебри Кеттеринга.

pt-BR.title: LASANHA SELVAGEM
pt-BR.description: Pedaço de lasanha abandonado na geladeira da firma quando o dono decidiu almoçar fora em vez de comê-la. Com o tempo, os micróbios da massa esquecida formaram um organismo colonial que roubou um iogurte, pulou a janela e atacou o carteiro. Foi vista pela última vez fugindo para uma floresta nos arredores de Kettering.

nl.title: LASAGNE (VERWILDERD)
nl.description: Dit restje lasagne werd achtergelaten in een koelkast toen de eigenaar in plaats daarvan besloot erop uit te gaan voor de lunch. Microben op de vergeten lasagne vormden uiteindelijk een koloniaal organisme dat een yoghurt stal, door een raam brak en een postbode op stelten joeg. Het werd voor het laatst gezien toen het de wildernis van Kettering in glipte.

ar.title: ﻻزاﻧﻴﺎ )ﺿﺎرة(
ar.description: ﺗﺮﻛﺖ ﻗﻄﻌﺔ اﻟﻼزاﻧﻴﺎ ﻫﺬه ﻓﻲ ﺛﻼﺟﺔ أﺣﺪ أﻣﺎﻛﻦ اﻟﻌﻤﻞ ﻋﻨﺪﻣﺎ ﻗﺮر ﺻﺎﺣﺒﻬﺎ ﺗﻨﺎول اﻟﻐﺪاء ﻓﻲ اﻟﺨﺎرج ﺑﺪﻻ ﻣﻦ أﻛﻠﻬﺎ. وﻓﻲ اﻟﻨﻬﺎﻳﺔ ﺷﻜﻠﺖ اﻟﻤﻴﻜﺮوﺑﺎت اﻟﻤﻮﺟﻮدة ﻋﻠﯽ ﻗﻄﻌﺔ اﻟﻼزاﻧﻴﺎ اﻟﻤﻨﺴﻴﺔ ﻛﺎﺋﻨﺎ ﻋﻀﻮﻳﺎ اﺳﺘﻌﻤﺎرﻳﺎ ﺳﺮق ﻋﻠﺒﺔ زﺑﺎدي وﻛﺴﺮ إﺣﺪى اﻟﻨﻮاﻓﺬ وﺧﺮج ﻣﻨﻬﺎ، ﺛﻢ ﻫﺪد ﺳﺎﻋﻲ ﺑﺮﻳﺪ. وآﺧﺮ ﻣﺮة ﺷﻮﻫﺪ ﻓﻴﻬﺎ ﻛﺎن ﻳﺠﺮي ﻣﺴﺮﻋﺎ ﻧﺤﻮ ﻏﺎﺑﺎت ﻛﻴﺘﺮﻳﻨﺞ.

tk.title: LAZANYA (VAHŞİ)
tk.description: Bu lazanya dilimi, sahibi öğle yemeği için dışarı çıkmayı tercih edince iş yeri buzdolabında kaderine terk edildi. Dolapta unutulan lazanyada oluşan mikroplar nihayetinde bir sömürge organizması oluşturarak yoğurdu çaldı, bir camı kırdı ve bir postacının ödünü kopardı. En son Kettering'in vahşi doğasına doğru kaçarken görülmüş.

fr-CA.title: LASAGNE (SAUVAGE)
fr-CA.description: Ce restant de lasagne a été abandonné dans un réfrigérateur de bureau lorsque son propriétaire a préféré dîner au restaurant. Des microbes ont fini par former un organisme colonial qui a volé un yogourt, s'est échappé par la fenêtre et a menacé un facteur. Elle a été vue pour la dernière fois dans les étendues sauvages de Kettering.

en-AU.title: LASAGNE (FERAL)
en-AU.description: This leftover slice of lasagne was abandoned in a workplace refrigerator when its owner decided to pop out for lunch instead. Microbes on the forgotten lasagne eventually formed a colonial organism that stole a yoghurt, smashed through a window, and menaced a postal worker. It was last seen scampering off into the wilds of Kettering.

landmarks.title: LASAGNE (FERAL)
landmarks.description: This leftover slice of lasagne was abandoned in a workplace refrigerator when its owner decided to pop out for lunch instead. Microbes on the forgotten lasagne eventually formed a colonial organism that stole a yogurt, smashed through a window, and menaced a postal worker. It was last seen scampering off into the wilds of Kettering.

landmarks.name: LM_LaundryRack

en.title: LAUNDRY STORAGE RACK
en.description: This peculiarly ornate laundry rack features a surprising number of moving parts. Once or twice per year, a human would clear away the clothing and sit on the contraption, pedaling furiously. Presumably this reactivated the rack's storage power, as laundry would soon start to reappear.

en-GB.title: LAUNDRY STORAGE RACK
en-GB.description: This peculiarly ornate laundry rack features a surprising number of moving parts. Once or twice per year, a human would clear away the clothing and sit on the contraption, pedaling furiously. Presumably this reactivated the rack's storage power, as laundry would soon start to reappear.

fr.title: SÉCHOIR À LINGE
fr.description: Ce séchoir bien fourni comporte un nombre surprenant de pièces mobiles. Une à deux fois par an, un humain débarrassait les vêtements et s'asseyait sur l'engin pour pédaler furieusement. Vraisemblablement, cela réactivait la puissance de stockage du support, car le linge recommençait à s'y accumuler juste après.

de.title: WÄSCHESTÄNDER
de.description: Dieser ungewöhnlich verzierte Wäscheständer besitzt eine erstaunliche Anzahl an beweglichen Teilen. Ein- bis zweimal pro Jahr entfernte ein Mensch jegliche Wäsche, setzte sich auf die Vorrichtung und begann, heftig zu strampeln. Dadurch wurde vermutlich die Lagerleistung des Ständers reaktiviert, da sich die Wäsche kurz darauf wieder ansammelte.

es.title: ESTANTE PARA ROPA SUCIA
es.description: Este estante para ropa sucia peculiarmente ornamentado incluye un número sorprendente de partes móviles. Una o dos veces al año, un humano quitaba la ropa y se sentaba en el artilugio, pedaleando furiosamente. Se cree que esto reactivaba el almacenamiento de energía del estante, puesto que la ropa sucia pronto empezaba a reaparecer.

it.title: PORTABIANCHERIA
it.description: Questo portabiancheria curiosamente decorato presenta una quantità sorprendente di componenti mobili. Con la cadenza di una o due volte l'anno, un umano toglieva i vestiti dal marchingegno e vi si sedeva sopra, pedalando furiosamente. Si suppone che così facendo riattivasse la capacità di accumulo del portabiancheria, dal momento che i vestiti avrebbero presto fatto nuovamente la loro comparsa.

ja.title: 洗濯用収納ラック
ja.description: この非常に華美な洗濯ラックには、驚くほど多くの可動部品が付いています。年に一度か二度、人間は洋服を片付けて、この奇妙な機械の上に座り、怒り狂ったようにペダルを踏むのです。洗濯物はすぐに再び現れ始めるため、おそらくこれによってラックの収納パワーが再発動されるのだと思われます。

ko.title: 빨래 걸이
ko.description: 이 특이한 장식이 있는 빨래 걸이에는 놀라울 정도로 많은 움직이는 부품이 있습니다. 인간들은 일 년에 한두 번씩 이 장치에 앉아 페달을 미친 듯이 밟으며 빨래를 했습니다. 아마 이 행위를 통해 빨래가 다시 나타나기 전에 빨래 걸이의 전력을 재충전했던 것 같습니다.

zh-Hans.title: 衣物存放架
zh-Hans.description: 这个尤为华丽的存放架包含多个移动部件。人类每年会清走衣服一两次，然后坐在这个奇妙的装置上猛踩踏板。这么做大概重新激活了存放架的储电系统，而洗好的衣服马上又要来了。

zh-Hant.title: 置衣架
zh-Hant.description: 這個奇特的華麗置衣架有好幾個能移動的部位。人類每年會收拾衣物一兩次，並坐在這個奇特裝置上猛踩踏板。這麼做大概是要重新啟動置衣架的儲電系統，因為洗好的衣物很快又會重新出現。

ru.title: ВЕШАЛКА ДЛЯ БЕЛЬЯ
ru.description: Эта оригинально украшенная вешалка для белья отличается удивительным количеством движущихся частей. Один или два раза в год человек убирал одежду и садился на хитроумное приспособление, яростно крутя педали. Предположительно, это перезапускало накопленную энергию вешалки, так как белье вскоре появлялось вновь.

pt-BR.title: REPOSITÓRIO DE ROUPA SUJA
pt-BR.description: Este repositório de roupa suja especialmente ornamentado tem uma quantidade surpreendente de peças móveis. Uma ou duas vezes por ano, um humano retirava as roupas sujas de cima do dispositivo e sentava nele para pedalar furiosamente. Presume-se que era assim que a reserva de energia do repositório era ativada para que mais roupas sujas pudessem voltar a aparecer.

nl.title: OPBERGREK VOOR WAS
nl.description: Dit bijzonder sierlijke wasrek is voorzien van een verrassend aantal bewegende delen. Een of twee keer per jaar verwijderde een mens de kleding, ging op het wonderlijke object zitten en trapte verwoed. Vermoedelijk reactiveerde dit de opbergcapaciteit van het rek, want de was verscheen al snel weer.

ar.title: رف ﺗﺨﺰﻳﻦ اﻟﻐﺴﻴﻞ
ar.description: ﻳﺘﻤﻴﺰ رف اﻟﻐﺴﻴﻞ اﻟﻤﺰﺧﺮف ﺑﺸﻜﻞ ﻓﺮﻳﺪ ﻫﺬا ﺑﻮﺟﻮد ﻋﺪد ﻛﺒﻴﺮ ﺟﺪا ﻣﻦ اﻷﺟﺰاء اﻟﻤﺘﺤﺮﻛﺔ. وﻳﺰﻳﻞ اﻟﺒﺸﺮ اﻟﻤﻼﺑﺲ ﻣﻦ ﻓﻮﻗﻪ ﻣﺮة أو ﻣﺮﺗﻴﻦ ﻓﻲ اﻟﻌﺎم، ﺛﻢ ﻳﺠﻠﺴﻮن ﻓﻮﻗﻪ ﻣﺤﺮﻛﻴﻦ أﻗﺪاﻣﻬﻢ ﺑﻌﻨﻒ. وﻣﻦ اﻟﻤﺤﺘﻤﻞ أن ﻳﻜﻮن ﻫﺬا اﻟﻔﻌﻞ ﻹﻋﺎدة ﺗﻨﺸﻴﻂ ﻗﺪرة اﻟﺮف اﻟﺘﺨﺰﻳﻨﻴﺔ، ﺣﻴﺚ ﻳﺒﺪأ اﻟﻐﺴﻴﻞ ﻓﻲ اﻟﻈﻬﻮر ﺑﻌﺪ ﻓﺘﺮة ﻗﺼﻴﺮة.

tk.title: ÇAMAŞIR DEPOLAMA ASKISI
tk.description: Bu alışılmışın dışında süslü çamaşır depolama rafının şaşırtıcı sayıda hareketli parçası bulunuyor. Yılda bir veya iki defa bir insan kıyafetleri kaldırıyor ve acayip alete oturarak hızlı hızlı pedal çeviriyordu. Muhtemelen bu işlem rafın depolama gücünü tekrar etkinleştiriyordu, çünkü çok geçmeden kıyafetler tekrar ortaya çıkıyordu.

fr-CA.title: SÉCHOIR À LINGE
fr-CA.description: Ce support à linge à l'allure particulière comporte un nombre surprenant de pièces mobiles. Une à deux fois par an, un humain en retirait les vêtements pour s'assoir sur l'engin et pédaler furieusement. Vraisemblablement, cela réactivait la puissance de stockage du support, car le linge recommençait à s'y accumuler juste après.

en-AU.title: LAUNDRY STORAGE RACK
en-AU.description: This peculiarly ornate laundry rack features a surprising number of moving parts. Once or twice per year, a human would clear away the clothing and sit on the contraption, pedaling furiously. Presumably this reactivated the rack's storage power, as laundry would soon start to reappear.

Once or twice per year, a human would clear away the clothing and sit on the contraption, pedaling furiously. Presumably this reactivated the rack's storage power, as laundry would soon start to reappear.

tk.description: Yapraklar ağaçların kartvizitleridir.
